Job Title: Director Operations

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
This positions responsibilities include coding, batching, inputting and balancing of all new business; cancellation requests; payments; adjustments; collections; refund checks; commission payments; and account/agent master file records, and ensures the adherence of underwriting guidelines, Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) procedures, and compliance with the laws and regulations in all states where credit insurance (life, accident, health (LAH)) and property and casualty products are marketed and sold. Works closely with other key departments to maintain proper record layouts, payment uploader processes, and proper communication to all parties. This role develops and maintains reporting and methods for identifying accounts with unusual activity. Acknowledges and tracks audit reports and creates and maintains an audit log of any outstanding audit violations.

Additional Key Accountabilities/Deliverables:

Responsible for determining commission percentages based on the guidelines and coding for each account/agent, paying service/administration agreement fees outside the Logic system, coordinating all agent records, commission and 1099 tax reporting, and preparing and analyzing various statistical reports. Responsible for the daily coding of payments, collection efforts on outstanding balances owed, research and investigation of outstanding accounts receivable balances, preparation of account receivable reconciliations and the establishment of relationships between accounts/agents, Financial Services division staff, and other department/division staff to ensure proper communication to hold accounts/agents current. Setup of the account master file records, account compensation records, contingent commission compensation records, and reinsurance and warehouse tables Develops and maintains reporting and methods for identifying accounts with unusual activity, including but not limited to high loss ratios. Ensures that the SOX documentation reflects current processes and controls. 

Experience:

Bachelor's degree in business and related field. 7+ years of experience in insurance/operations. 

At Core Specialty, you will receive a competitive salary and opportunities for professional development and advancement. We offer medical, dental, vision, and life insurances; short and long-term disability; a Company-match of 100% of a 6% contribution 401(k) plan; an Employee Assistance Plan; Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account, Health Reimbursement Account, and a wellness program

Experience Level (if available): Director
